subject: Back in Melbourne
event:
We have emerged from the depths of the Jenolan Caves and returned to Melbourne again to unwind for a couple of days before flying back to Santa Fe... and the mountain of work that awaits there.

Got back to Melbourne last night just in time for a birthday dinner with friends.  Sixty two.  Ghods.  I am officially a geezer.  Oh, well.  I've been geezing for years, if truth be told.  Expect me to continue to wave my cane vigorously at all you young'uns and tell you how much better things were in my day.

(The Jenolan Caves are very cool, by the way.  Especially at night, when the coaches leave and the possums and marsupial mice emerge).

comments.article: happy birthday!
I hope to never get a birthday message from the grim reaper!
comments.subject: Spooky!

comments.article: Happy belated Birthday!
Happy Birthday from Russia :)
comments.subject: Na zdorovie

comments.article: Happy birthday! Geezing is okay, I guess, as long as you continue to be awesome ;)

happy birthday! it was my birthday on sunday 19th of september!

are you in melbourne, australia? because that's where i live!! i'm a big fan of your books, its really cool that you and i could be in the same city at the same time!

Happy Birthday - from me in Melbourne (I'm on the train to work now) to you in Melbourne!

I hope you took the Klingon tour guide in the Jenolan Caves!
comments.subject: HB

comments.article:
A belated happy birthday, George. May you give Methuselah a run for his money!

And for those who are living in Jenolan or other, similar caves, HBO has released some great stuff this past weekend. You can see the new teaser and a behind the scenes featurette at http://www.makinggameofthrones.com/, and can follow the official HBO GoT twitter at http://twitter.com/gameofthrones.

We've got a gallery of screen captures from the featurette and new teaser here, with commentary and comments from visitors, as some of those scenes flash by reeeeeal quick.

Which reminds me that I wanted to comment here with this new icon of Dany, but I forgot because I'm forgetful. The new trailer is really interesting, I hope it'll catch the attention of non-ASOIAF fans :)

~From the wallpaper at the official site
Have Birthday, George! May there be many more!!!
comments.subject: :-D

comments.article:
And it isn't even belated: it's still the 20th (Australia's yesterday) here in the States.

(Have you seen the teaser and/or behind-the-scenes bit? Any thoughts?)
comments.subject: Happy Birthday!

comments.article: Congrats and geeze on, sir! (BTW, does anyone know if geezing comes before or after curmudging?)

Happy Birthday Mr Georges.
Best wishes for next year!

Greatings from France, and thanks for taking time to share those moments with us.
Happy birthday, GRRM!  My husband says to tell you that if you worked where he does (Pratt & Whitney), you could retire now {g}....
If I retired, my fans would come and kill me.
Happy Birthday, George!
Happy birthday, George! The longer you're around, the better the world will be for lovers of books everywhere.

Happy Birthday George! It's weird, you and my dad were born mere weeks apart. (Don't worry, I'm not altogether too old myself, so having people tell you, that you are their dad's age, need not make you shudder.)
comments.subject: Happy Birthday!

comments.article: 62 isn't old.  Katharine Hepburn won 3 Oscars after turning 61.   Johnny Cash released 7 more albums and won 10 Grammys after turning 62.  You're at the top of your game.

Every time you travel it makes me nervous. Please lay off the green veggies the day before and the day of your flight. We can’t have you getting a pulmonary embolism from a deep vein thrombus. Be safe and happy birthday.
Is that actually linked to green veggies??

geeze away, m'dear, and wave away - I shall wave back with a sharp sword :)

Hurry to Ireland - your place is set and I am just after pouring your glass of Mist :) and I have a new one to try - it's called Scotsmac - Danger Will Robinson it is a whiskey mead type of thing - it has powered vikings all summer and awaits your pleasure.
comments.subject: Happy Day for the other day :)

comments.article: Belated birthday wishes!

You are two years older than my dad, for the record, but he still runs full court basketball every week with guys in their 20s and 30s. So...there's that.

Do you have ANY idea what's been going on with the Giants and Jets this year? Or is that all going to be a DVR "catching up" kind of thing?
comments.subject: Happy birthday, George!

comments.article: I know the Giants won their opener against the Panthers, as [reviously posted.  Other than that, no, it will all be waiting for me at home.
comments.subject: Re: Happy birthday, George!

comments.upictitle: angusscream: Я и мой ESP Eclipse II
comments.article: Happy Birthday, Mr. Martin!!! Wish you to live twice as long and be healthy and happy!!!
Happy Birthday to us!  Hope yours was as good as mine.
comments.subject: Birthday

comments.article:
You're posting from THE FUTURE!!

Happy Birthday!

You find possums and marsupials to be nice? :) That sounds a little more on the unnerving side to me.

Anyway, happy birthday, good sir!

David Bowie is 63 years old--one year older than you--and David Bowie is, has been, and always will be the height of cool. If David Bowie's still rocking it (and he is), you're no geezer. Happy birthday! ~:D
comments.subject: Geezer?!
